items.name: maxSessionTimeout
items.description: The maximum session timeout, in milliseconds, that the ZooKeeper Server will allow the client to negotiate

items.name: server_jmx_rmi_port
items.description: The port used by the ZooKeeper Server's RMI server to handle JMX RMI requests. This is added as "-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.rmi.port=<port>" to the ZooKeeper Server's JVM command line. This has an effect only in Oracle JDK 7u4 and higher. If the setting is left blank, the JMX Remote Port value is used. If set to 0 or -1, this setting is ignored. When this setting is not in effect, the JVM uses a random port for the RMI server.

items.name: zookeeper_server_outstanding_requests_window
items.displayName: ZooKeeper Server Outstanding Requests Monitoring Period
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of the outstanding requests queue size. Specified in minutes.

items.name: zookeeper_server_data_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Data Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its database snapshots.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its database snapshots. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Server logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: minSessionTimeout
items.description: The minimum session timeout, in milliseconds, that the ZooKeeper Server will allow the client to negotiate

items.name: clientPort
items.description: The port to monitor for client connections. This is the port that clients attempt to connect to.

items.name: zookeeper_server_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: zk_server_log_dir
items.description: Directory where ZooKeeper will place its log files.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: zookeeper_server_connection_count_window
items.displayName: ZooKeeper Server Connection Count Monitoring Period
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of the connection count. Specified in minutes.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules which govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that may be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages whose contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages which are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:{"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}

This rule will send events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: enable_jmx_agent
items.description: Enables the JMX agent on the ZooKeeper server. Turning this off on any of the ZooKeeper servers that are part of a service will prevent Cloudera Manager from being able to monitor that server and may affect the monitoring provided on the entire service.

items.name: zookeeper_server_data_log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Transaction Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its transaction logs..

items.name: enable_jmx_authentication
items.displayName: Enable Authenticated Communication with the JMX Agent
items.description: Enables authentication when interacting with the JMX agent on the ZooKeeper server.

items.name: zookeeper_server_quorum_membership_enabled
items.description: Enables the quorum membership check for this ZooKeeper Server.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Server Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: jmx_passwd_file_readonly_user
items.displayName: Name of User with Read-Only access to the JMX Agent
items.description: Specifies the name of the user that has read-only privileges when using password file based authentication for JMX access. JMX authentication must be enabled for this setting to take effect.

items.name: zookeeper_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for zoo.cfg
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into zoo.cfg for this role only.

items.name: quorumPort
items.description: The port to monitor for inter-server communication

items.name: zookeeper_server_outstanding_requests_thresholds
items.description: The health check thresholds of the weighted average size of the ZooKeeper Server outstanding requests queue over a recent period. See ZooKeeper Server Outstanding Requests Monitoring Period.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: zk_server_java_opts
items.displayName: Java Configuration Options for Zookeeper Server
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: zookeeper_server_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Server's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: jmx_passwd_file_readwrite_user
items.displayName: Name of User with Read-Write Access to the JMX Agent
items.description: Specifies the name of the user that has read-write privileges when using password file based authentication for JMX access. JMX authentication must be enabled for this setting to take effect.

items.name: dataLogDir
items.description: The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its transaction logs.

items.name: maxClientCnxns
items.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by the IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. This setting is used to prevent certain classes of DoS attacks, including file descriptor exhaustion. To remove the limit on concurrent connections, set this value to 0.

items.name: server_jmx_agent_port
items.description: The port used by the ZooKeeper Server's RMI registry. This is required to enable JMX access through RMI which is required for Cloudera Manager ZooKeeper monitoring. This is added as "-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port" to the ZooKeeper Server's JVM command line.

items.name: jmx_passwd_file_readonly_user_password
items.displayName: Password of User with Read-Only Access to the JMX agent
items.description: Specifies the password of the user that has read-only privileges when using password file based authentication for JMX access. JMX authentication must be enabled for this setting to take effect.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: jmx_passwd_file_readwrite_user_password
items.displayName: Password of user with read-write access to the JMX agent
items.description: Specifies the password of the user that has read-write privileges when using password file based authentication for JMX access. JMX authentication must be enabled for this setting to take effect.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: serverId
items.description: Unique identifier for each ZooKeeper server, typically starts at 1

items.name: clientPortAddress
items.description: The address (IPv4, IPv6, or hostname) to monitor for client connections. This is the address that clients attempt to connect to. This setting is optional, because by default, ZooKeeper binds in such a way that any connection to the client port for any address/interface/NIC on the server will be accepted.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: zookeeper_server_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of ZooKeeper Server in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: zookeeper_server_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: zookeeper_server_data_log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Transaction Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its transaction logs.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its transaction logs. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: dataDir
items.description: The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its database snapshots.

items.name: zookeeper_server_quorum_membership_detection_window
items.description: The tolerance window that will be used in the detection of a ZooKeeper server's membership in a quorum. Specified in minutes.

items.name: zookeeper_server_connection_count_thresholds
items.description: The health check thresholds of the weighted average size of the ZooKeeper Server connection count over a recent period. See ZooKeeper Server Connection Count Monitoring Period.

items.name: zookeeper_server_max_latency_thresholds
items.description: The percentage thresholds of the ratio of the maximum request latency to the maximum client-negotiable session timeout since the server was started.

items.name: SERVER_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Server Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: zookeeper_server_data_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Data Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The disk location that ZooKeeper will use to store its database snapshots..

items.name: electionPort
items.description: The port to monitor for leadership election

items.name: zookeeper_server_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall Server health, consider the host's health.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: zookeeper_server_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: service_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this service. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific service.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the followig JSON formatted trigger fires if there are more than 10 DataNodes with more than 500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleType = DataNode and last(fd_open) > 500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 10, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: cleanupRetainCount
items.description: The number of snapshot files and corresponding transaction logs to keep when running the Cleanup command.

items.name: zookeeper_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: ZooKeeper Service Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: kerberos_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal short name used by all roles of this service.

items.name: zookeeper_canary_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health check that a client can connect to ZooKeeper and perform basic operations

items.name: leaderServes
items.description: Whether the leader accepts client connections.

items.name: syncLimit
items.description: Amount of time, in ticks, to allow followers to sync with ZooKeeper. If followers fall too far behind a leader, they are dropped.

items.name: zookeeper_servers_healthy_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall Server health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" Servers falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" Servers falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: smon_derived_configs_safety_valve
items.displayName: Service Monitor Derived Configs Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a list of derived configuration properties that will be used by the Service Monitor instead of the default ones.

items.name: catch_events
items.description: When set, each role identifies important log events and forwards them to Cloudera Manager.

items.name: jute_maxbuffer
items.description: The maximum size of the data that can be stored in a znode in bytes.

items.name: zookeeper_datadir_autocreate
items.description: Automatically create data directories at startup, if they do not exist. Enabling this configuration should be used with care as it will suppress any errors in setup of data directories.

items.name: process_username
items.description: The user that this service's processes should run as.

items.name: autopurgeInterval
items.description: The time interval in hours for which the purge task has to be triggered. Set to a positive integer (1 and above) to enable the auto purging. Defaults to 24.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: zookeeper_canary_session_timeout
items.description: Configures the timeout used by the canary sessions with ZooKeeper servers

items.name: initLimit
items.description: Amount of time, in ticks, to allow followers to connect and sync to a leader. Increase this value as needed, if the amount of data managed by ZooKeeper is large.

items.name: zookeeper_canary_connection_timeout
items.description: Configures the timeout used by the canary for connection establishment with ZooKeeper servers

items.name: zookeeper_canary_operation_timeout
items.description: Configures the timeout used by the canary for ZooKeeper operations

items.name: zookeeper_canary_root_path
items.description: Configures the path of the root znode under which all canary updates are performed

items.name: autopurgeSnapRetainCount
items.description: When enabled, ZooKeeper auto purge feature retains this many most recent snapshots and the corresponding transaction logs in the dataDir and dataLogDir respectively and deletes the rest. Defaults to 5. Minimum value is 3.

items.name: tickTime
items.description: The length of time, in milliseconds, of a single tick, which is the basic time unit used by ZooKeeper. A tick is used to regulate heartbeats and timeouts.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this service reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: enableSecurity
items.description: Enable Kerberos authentication for ZooKeeper.

items.name: log_event_retry_frequency
items.description: The frequency in which the log4j event publication appender will retry sending undelivered log events to the Event server, in seconds

items.name: process_groupname
items.description: The group that this service's processes should run as.
